summary: Cornwell is mentioned in one document (144-10001-10249) as being involved in a report with Klein regarding their interview with Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson, USAF. The report concerned a facility able to collect the Lisbon-Tangier link. Julia Wetzel from the NSA reviewed this report and ensured its classification. There is no other information about Cornwell in the provided documents.
significance: Cornwell's significance in the JFK context is limited to their involvement in a report concerning communications intelligence related to the Lisbon-Tangier link, as revealed in an interview with Sgt. Nicholas B. Stevenson. The report was reviewed by the NSA and deemed sensitive enough to warrant classification. The exact nature of the report's connection to the JFK assassination is not specified in the provided documents.
